en: A few beta-testers are reporting problems you can't replicate on your computer. It seems they're running on a different operating system, but you don't have access to a computer with that system.
However, only a fraction of people use this operating system, so it might be something you can put off fixing until later. Should you buy a new computer to test this, or let it go?
When you finally find the bug, you realize it could've been earth-shattering. You're grateful you caught it now.
You decide not to mess with it. You don't need to be spending a lot of money when you're not sure you'll make it back.
